comment: Taking Algebra with Mrs. Ellis was a great foundation for my later STEM classes. Whether or not you are coming into college with a great or poor understanding of math, she takes it slow and is very caring.
Mrs. Ellis is an amazing lecturer. She is great with her explanations and is always open to helping her students.
She's a very nice professor. She made ALEKS better with not using modules and she have printable handouts to go along with the lectures.

New name is Prof. Dinkins. She does NOT use the ALEKS module system - work there is just static assignments which was a MASSIVE relief for me personally. Offers extra credit on tests for review-esque work. Attendance not 100% necessary but there are some worksheets that are usually graded for participation. Her lectures are very helpful anyways!

Mrs. Ellis is so sweet! There are printable lecture sheets available on D2L that she will go through during her lectures; they are very helpful. Also, she allows you to use a note card on some tests, including the final. She is very understanding and knows what she is doing.
Great Professor. As long as you do the HW, the class will be easy

she is a very nice and caring teacher, her teaching style just didn't mesh with me. I had to learn many of the topics on my own. class revolved around aleks online work and tests. attendance was only 6% of your grade. weekly homework, but nothing out of the ordinary for a math class. take her if you can get her at a good time slot.

College Algebra with Professor Ellis was a breeze. She's accommodating of special circumstances and more than capable of explaining each concept several different ways should you struggle with understanding when explained the first time.
She is a great teacher and offers some extra credit. On the last tests and final she lets you use a note card.

She was amazing. I'm just genuinely a dumb student and she made her class really easy to understand. Attendance is mandatory but she also drops absences, I'm not the type to pay attention in class so I just did all the ALEKS HW and study guides and did well, super caring and understanding of outside circumstances and helped me a lot

TAKE HER!! At first she may go kind of fast, but never hesitate to ask her questions or email her outside of class. She's very helpful and easy to approach, and she gives partial credit on all of her unit tests (4 tests). It can be a lot of homework sometimes, but it's manageable especially after the lecture (but you can work ahead). She's lovely!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Fall 2023, Great professor who cares. Tips for you to succeed: Printout her handouts as it will help you with notes, if you struggle go to the math lab they help you, attendance is important, ask questions if you dont know it she WILL help you but you have to ask and lastly her tests come from the practice tests so do them early and understand it.

cried on the first day. Bc she started teaching what we "should alr know" from previous math classes. im not good at math at all but her si session w daniel helped me tremendously. I wouldnt have passed without him. She does help if you ask for help. but if not she will assume u alr know whats goin on. shes a nice person tho.

She just got married so now her name is Brandi Dinkins. She is dope for Precal I passed the class with over a 100. I took her over the summer, but you have to lock in a get that work in. I also was given a lot of helpful sources like SI and Smart center by her for extra help. She also is available after hours for help. There is extra credit too.

Her class can be kinda boring but she makes learning the material very easy. Attendance is very important in the class, I suggest going every time, you will use Aleks for HW which honestly is super annoying to do but it does help out a lot, make sure to do her practice test because almost everything from the pre-test is on the test itself.
Best math professor at KSU. Tests were similar to ALEKS study guides. Prepared me well for Calculus also.

I wished she taught Calc one :(, enjoyed her class and made difficult topic easy to understand, very accessible outside of class and did not grade test as hard, and gave partial credit which I liked! Gives a study guide before the test, make sure you do the study guide multiple times to understand the material!

Mrs. Ellis was a very kind and helpful teacher. I enjoyed her class and found it easy to understand because of her great teaching. She is willing to help you as much as you need if you have a question.

Ellis is a not so good professor if you don't already know what you are doing.I was not doing so well in this class and i asked her what can I do and told her all that i am doing in the class(hw,SI sessions,study center etc) she proceeded to quite literally recite everything i just said to her. She was no help to struggling students! Dont take her!
Very very great professor just do the work and youll be good

I recommend taking her class because she makes a complicated math concept into something that I can understand very easily. Also, when taking her class, make sure you do the practice test at least twice, and the last time right before the test to get a high test grade plus, there is partial credit if you get the problem wrong. Take her class!

Loved this professor but most of what I learned was from Aleks. She was very lenient with grading and gave many opportunities to make up or get extra credit. In-class assignments matter but she drops a few at the end. Very homework heavy.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: She is so sweet and really cares about her students. She wants to make sure yo understand the material and gives different examples to make it clear. She does extra credit on the tests sometimes and always gives as much credit as she can on the tests. We have practice tests in ALEKS and she uses half of those questions for the real test.

Prof. Brandi is an ok math professor. If you already know what you are doing in math and are naturally good at it take her class. She goes way too fast when explaining the problems and does most of the math in her head and does not write down how she got to that answer. She is a nice lady but I would not take her again.

Honestly one of the best math teacher's I've had in my entire life. She explains everything so clearly and goes out of her way to prove why something is true mathematically, especially for precalculus.
She is super sweet and very caring about students! good at breaking things down to be able to understand. u Homework and test practices get you well prepared for exams. If you do your homework easy A

Miss Brandi is such an amazing algebra teacher! She explains material thoroughly and the homework reflects the all the tests. There are weekly homeworks and if you wait until the last minute, it will be stressful and you will stress. Do the homework and show up and you'll be fine.
She is very clear on what you need to know/complete.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: I looked at the ratings for this professor and thought i was ok for the semester. I was wrong, the 4 tests that she gives you are 48% of your grade!! I made a 78 on my first quiz and it dropped my grade down to a 85. Her lectures goes by way too fast, its like she expects you to learn 3 topics within an hour. Dont take if you want to save your GPA.

I suck at math, grade schoolers could have passed this course before I could. Took her in the summer, am I a math Wiz? NO. Did I get an A on both my test? Absolutely I did. If math is not your forte, and you're just desperate to get into the nursing program with a good grade, trust, take her. It is a lot of work, but achievable. Uses Aleks for HW
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Mrs. Ellis has been the best math professor I had. Please take her, she is truly awesome! you do get homework every week but she is such an angel she truly cares about her students and shows her true passion for teaching and to me I think that truly makes A GOOD teacher.. Pls take her if you can! you wont regret it!!!

Professor Ellis is truly amazing. It is true that she assigns weekly homework for the chapters we are going through, but the homework gives you an in-depth understanding of the material. She has given extra credit opportunities for all of the tests and truly wants you to succeed. Take her!

Ehh. not the best at teaching but shes also new so shell definitely improve with time. My only issue was all the homework and frequency of quizzes. Didnt feel like good pacing to me. Too fast for me to learn properly
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Prof. Ellis is a solid choice for college algebra. She teaches very well, and isn't confusing. She's not super outgoing, but she's very nice, plus it's a math class so it's okay. Definitely show up to class! She takes attendance randomly (and also missing a math class isn't good anyway, just show up)
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Ms. Ellis teaches very clearly and is willing to answer any questions about the lesson. Online homework on Aleks is time consuming. The study guides are key to prepare for all tests.

Shes a very nice lady and throughly goes over topics. Theres one homework assignment a week in Aleks and she always answers emails if you need help. Tests are very similar to the study guide and shes also a really nice lady.

Prof. Ellis is a good teacher, however I wish there would've been a little bit more of her personality involved (could've been my specific class though). Besides that though, she taught the content really well. The class is really easy, so don't worry.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She's a good teacher, you can only miss three classes with an excuse. There's homework every week so please always check ALEKS. DO THE STUDY GUIDES you can get extra points on your test and it's great for review. Her class is actually easy to pass just make sure you show up!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: You have to show up because you can only miss 3 classes before you have to have a documented excuse. All her work is on ALEKS and that's where she enters all her grades so you dont have to wait to the end of the year to see it. going to class makes it easier to do her weekly homework because she gives great examples in class. pay attention and pass
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Nothing out of this world. She is a decent teacher, my only knock is how slow she teaches, the class is absurdly easy and could and should be taught significantly faster. That being said tests and quizzes are in-person, but are absolute cake walks. Overall solid teacher, just did not enjoy her teaching style. Not my cup of tea, but could be yours.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: She is very nice and will tell you everything important. She reminds about due dates and take attendance randomly. Would definitely take again if I was able to. She explains things multiple ways if need be. Asking questions in class will really help.

Great professor. Only complaint is shes a little soft spoken (not too bad tho), the way she explains stuff sometimes is a lil confusing, and ALEKS (but I think all math teachers have to use this) She really cares abt her students, and puts out study guides very similar to tests, and reminds us about due dates. Its a bit of a tough course so study
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: I absolutely loved Professor Ellis. She takes attendance for a grade but the class is actually kind of fun. She teaches really well and her lecture slides are available any time on D2L. She is easy to work with and explains topics in multiple ways to give everyone the chance to understand. I'd take her again if I could. The HW helps a lot.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures
